definitions.text: the act of putting something in working order again
a formal way of referring to the condition of something
examples: the building was in good repair

definitions.text: restore by replacing a part or putting together what is torn or broken
make amends for; pay compensation for
examples: One can never fully repair the suffering and losses of the Jews in the Third Reich
She was compensated for the loss of her arm in the accident

definitions.text: move, travel, or proceed toward some place
examples: He repaired to his cabin in the woods

definitions.text: give new life or energy to
examples: A hot soup will revive me
